website_summaries.verdict: Although it offers notable performance and power, you can find similar qualities in less expensive options on our list.
pros: Has a powerful 5.50 torque engine, yet owners give it high marks for being easy to handle
Not extremely loud considering the power it delivers
Build has a very sturdy feel, and depth control is easy to adjust
cons: Mixed reviews on how reliable it is to start
Quality control could be better, as some packages arrived with damage

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality - Poor Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I thoroughly researched edgers and thought this would be the "life-time" edger needed for home use. After SEVEN uses, the engine (Briggs & Stratton) engine seized. I checked the oil level and found everything fine. I contacted McLane's customer service and was promptly dismissed, stating, 'oh, we do not do anything with engines, you will need to contact Briggs & Stratton'. For a lawn product costing over $600, I expected more from McLane's. Save yourself any headaches and do not buy a McLane product. The Poor Quality and Customer Service are not there....
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the negative reviews.  This is a great machine!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical after all the negative reviews, but after trying it I love this thing! There is an over heating issue on the drive pulley, but it's not bad enough to cause problems. I suspect maybe the other reviewers were possibly running this thing at full throttle? ...using too much belt tension? ... using a ticker or longer blade then provided? The only problem I'm having is blade wear. It wears quickly... and that's probably due to my excessive use! Don't let the negative reviews fool you. This is a great machine!
customer_reviews.author: Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts!!!
customer_reviews.text: Upon unboxing my edger. I found to my disappointment that it was missing the owners manual, rubber grips, and fasteners that would allow me to assemble and start using it. I contacted the 800 number and was immediately sent to their outsourced customer service group. The lady I spoke to was very nice and said they would ship me the missing pieces. I will update this review once I receive them and can actually use it.
customer_reviews.author: jm72761

customer_reviews.title: McLane lawn edger
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Awesome! One of the best lawn equipment purchases I’ve made. Easy to assemble, kind of on the heavy size but that just be me. My lawn looks better then my other neighbors who hire Landscapers to do their lawns. I’m dancing all over my lawn and laughing about the money my neighbors are wasting hiring companies to do the same thing I’m doing with this machine on my own. Thumbs up! Perfect! I highly recommend this lawn edger.
customer_reviews.author: JoeG65

customer_reviews.title: Amazing machine
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Mc. edger......and is by far better than another brand I own. But it is especially the best for prepping an area for new sod. I am amazed that it starts on the first pull every time! My only complaint is the smooth handle bars which are not as good as previous handle bars which were bigger and more like bicycle handle bars...better grip.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Smith

customer_reviews.title: This is not a Heavy Duty Machine at all
customer_reviews.text: Satisfied with customer service. I had to return the item the day after I received the item. Starts easy! Chews up belts and blades within minutes of first use. I went and purchased multiple belts and blades just to finish one job. I had to finish the job with the edging attachment that is on my weed eater. Would not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Shane M. Roppolo

customer_reviews.title: Well built machine made to last
customer_reviews.text: This machine makes edging a breeze. I had an industrial edger I used for over 20 years before it quit. Have bought name brand edgers, I believe 3, and ended up trashing them. Found this edger on a google search and read all the reviews and decided to buy it. Never will I regret this purchase. Well built and reduces work time substantially. Would highly recommend this edger for anyone who takes care of their own yard. Neighbors comment regularly about how nice our yard looks and my yard is totally enhanced by clean cut edges!
customer_reviews.author: Willard Paul Oleson

customer_reviews.title: This is a good, solid machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, solid machine. Would have given a 5 if it wasn't for the slightly confusing controls. There is a lever for the fuel, one for the speed, one for the choke and an ignition switch. First you have to remember to turn on the ignition, then you have to put the three levers in the right positions, which aren't clearly marked. Also, there is a rubber safety guard behind the blade that hindered the forward motion of the edger, so I removed it. If you can memorize where the levers go, no problem and no problems once I removed the guard. But, I still like the machine.
customer_reviews.author: jscilla

customer_reviews.title: Work saver big time
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine. It will produce really professional edging results this spring. Can't wait for the snow to melt so I can get started. I tested it a little, so far, and it's easy to use. Should have bought this years ago. I really like how stable the wheel base is. The whole machine is very stable and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: ED JR

customer_reviews.title: A good quality edger
customer_reviews.text: Right of the box I knew this was a quality edger. It is solidly built. I've used it only 5 times but can tell it is going to last a long time. It does an excellent job of edging my sidewalks. There was a learning curve but it didn't take long to become proficient.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald C. Pacanowski

customer_reviews.title: It doen't run!
customer_reviews.text: The edger was easy to put together....but.....it doesn't run. It was hard to start; the blade slightly rotated when in the starting position; the throttle mark on the handle did not match the throttle mark on the motor. After a struggle to start the edger, it would not run long enough to begin edging. The edger is now with lawn equipment repair shop (an added cost) to get it to function properly and run continuously.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One tough edger that is worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: The first McLane edger lasted me over 25 years. Just got the new one and it started on first pull after I added gas and oil. One of the best, if not the best edger built. Buy it for a lifetime. You won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Cyn D

customer_reviews.title: Great manufacturer. I have had one of the original ...
customer_reviews.text: Great manufacturer. I have had one of the original models purchased used in 1975. It still works great and gave to my son. I purchased this one basically to get the newer version that has two wheels in front and a recoil starter rope. Makes it a little easier as you get older. Starts easily usually on the second pull. I edge every other week, which is over 4600 feet of edging. Reliability is not an issue. Easy to operate and also to change oil or service. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: lardog

customer_reviews.title: What I Expect from American-made Products
customer_reviews.text: Great performer. I went out of my way to buy American and this is nearly perfect. The only gripe I have is the throttle cable doesn't allow full travel and seems kind of thrown together. The throttle on the motor seems to use its full amount of travel but the cable on the handle only moves about 1/4 of the available. Maybe they use the same cable for all their motor options. The blades last surprisingly long compared to every other edger I've used. Don't leave gasohol in it, though. It will foul the carb in about a month of sitting around.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary N. Browne

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Use it to re-edge landscape and to cut along through edge of a long driveway. Wheels do not turn which I expected. Makes curved edges a hit cumbersome. I satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Great American Made Edger
customer_reviews.text: After 10+ years of using an Echo 2 stroke Stick edger I went back to the original Briggs and Stratton 4 stroke roller type. I cut 2 properties with St Augustine grass in South Florida and am very happy. I got tired of constant carb issues with the oil and ethanol gas mix. This McLane model reminds me of my old reliable Powertrim model that I had back in the 80's.I also find that rolling is easier on my 54 year old back than carrying and rolling the stick type. It works great and is well made and should last me until I mow my last lawn! lol
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Oconnor

customer_reviews.title: McLane 801 5.50GT Gross Torque Briggs & Stratton 9-inch Gas Powered Edger
customer_reviews.text: My husband just received this edger today and was excited to try it out. He is very mechanical so he has no problem putting things together. It would have been nice if they had sent all of the nuts, washers, and key to put it together. I expect if this company wants to keep a good rating that they send me the required nuts, washers, and key to put it together. I expect them to send these items promptly. Whoever does your inventory control is not very good. As soon as we receive the parts, I will write another review on how it works.
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: Good Machine, Satisfying to use!
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing so pleasing as seeing the sharp clean edges that this machine leaves. If you understand that it will not slice through hard pan or tree roots, it is a great machine. It beat using a weed whacker and chewing up the yard. If you are patient and use this regularly, it will make your edging sharp!
customer_reviews.author: NE Outdoors

customer_reviews.title: See above.
customer_reviews.text: A control stick was missing from our order. The box looked like it had gone thru a war and the shaft where you put the handle on seemed bent or crooked. We did not send the product back because my husband had an accident and since we are both in our 60’s we had trouble lifting it. We did wind up putting the thing together using a control shaft from our older edger model. They were the same size. All in all we made it work.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Madden

customer_reviews.title: McLane Edger is the Best!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second McLane edger. The first, I used for over 10 years as a community maintenance volunteer. We edged some sidewalks that had never been edged in 30 years. The McLane is fearless! :-) The machine still starts easily and runs well, but it was time for a new one. I love this product!
customer_reviews.author: William E Moser

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart
customer_reviews.text: Welds are breaking. Pull rope doesn't retract. Rubber shield broke off. Belt broke. Not that powerful for anything other than edging.
customer_reviews.author: Mike I

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it's supposed to do with ease. I bought a smaller edger from Sears and burned up the clutch before I finished my lawn one time. Since the McLane arrived I've done my lawn 5 or 6 times with absolutely no problem. It starts very easily and runs quietly with plenty of power. According to other reviewers the throttle will break if you force it, so don't force it (it only goes half way) and it won't break. The only complaint I have is the oil fill location is amazingly difficult to access. Not impossible, but difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Nielo

customer_reviews.title: You can buy excellent American made edgers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this edger because the vibration from my edger attachment on my Echo weed eater was causing me problems. This thing solved the vibration problem and cut my edging time in half. It took about 30 min to assemble. The instructions are vague, but understandable. It is well made, and the speed control and clutch arm assembly are made of metal. This thing is easy to use with a short learning curve. There is a fuel shutoff valve under the choke that must be in the forward position. I wish I had bought this sooner. Plus it was made in America
customer_reviews.author: fxrp

customer_reviews.title: under powered engine
customer_reviews.text: The machine arrived promptly. It was poorly packaged and I was suprised nothing was damaged in transit. It assembled quickly but there is what appears to be a fuel cut off switch which isn't documented in owners manual and doesn't appear to do anything. I have used the edger a few times and the engine struggles if you dig deep. My two year old power mate edger from home depot does not have this problem and it was much cheaper than the Mclane. This model is ok for very basic edging work only.
customer_reviews.author: Jose E. Ibarra

customer_reviews.title: belt failed
customer_reviews.text: Had just one month and the belt frayed and ready to break otjer than that works ok dont understand why the belt needs replaced already Y
customer_reviews.author: Douglas S.

customer_reviews.title: McLane Edger
customer_reviews.text: Top of the line. I wish I had purchased this 25 years ago. Quality built. Since I'm pushing 70 years of age, this will be my LAST edger. Works flawlessly. Easier to use than my Craftsman that lasted me 15 years. Recommend using Mobil One or Castrol Edge synthetic motor oil in the engine. My HONDA lawnmower still starts on 1/2 pull after 23 years. I could see a person easily getting 35 years of service from this edger. Looking at the construction, I'd classify this edger as a "commercial" edger for use by a landscaper.
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Brody

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure which one to pick. I picked it because it could do the curb and straight edge. It starts every time on one pull. Two things be aware. I needed to adjust it twice so the blade will not run when it is not suppose to. AND there are two oil fill plugs. The front one is there because it is a common engine and you can not put oil in that area - only the back. BUT those a small to how nice it cuts, the adjustable blade is great doing the street edge. I like this edger a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Christmas guy

customer_reviews.title: Broken starter after just 1 pull.
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure I will love this edger. Easy to assemble, however... the plastic casing that holds the starter spring completely broke in half on the first pull. Engine did start but string did not rewind. I am optimistic that once I get over this speed bump, the edger will be just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Seagroves

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price...seems fine so far
customer_reviews.text: opened it up, did the minor assembly required in a few minutes, filled it with oil (tilt it to get it in faster, get it flat, let the excess run out...OK to fill to absolute capacity, I used plain ol 30 weight motor oil). Put gas in it, choke, pull (pulls very easily) and started instantly. Ran it for a few minutes, then tried it for just about 3 feet or edging and works like a charm. Can't beat the low noise of a 4 cyl motor (much quieter than I expected). For $300, seems like a nice machine.
customer_reviews.author: SDB

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought one long ago
customer_reviews.text: The comments made about the plastic throttle control are correct. It does not want to stay in place. However, everything else about this edger is wonderful. It used to take an hour to do my edging with the stick models that swap heads between string trimmers and edgers. I did the job in 10 minutes with the McLane. If I had known how easy this one is, I would have purchased it long ago. I use it for the curb as well. It is not as easy there, since only 2 of the 4 wheels make contact there, but it is still better than previous types I have used.
customer_reviews.author: D R from Beavercreek

customer_reviews.title: Worth its weight in gold
customer_reviews.text: This is not light but makes up for it with power purched two or three a year of other brands because I did not want to spend the money for this one. Should have saved by purchasing this one from the jump I would have saved thousands over the last four years at three a year for box store competitor products
customer_reviews.author: David Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what was expected
customer_reviews.text: Although the engine is manufactured in Mexico, it still performs well and started with 1 pull of the rope after all fluids were filled. Down side is no oil was provided. The self propelled feature is fantastic, you just need to guide the edger straight. I give this item 5 stars because it's NOT "Made in China" crap and has no flimsy plastic parts on it. All other stores I visited for an edger came with 50% plastic shields and parts.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: McLane isn't the product it used to be; it's just not the quality of the same product purchased several years ago. Also, obviously this seller is shipping "factory seconds" as this one had a damaged gas tank even though the shipping carton had no evidence of mishandling in shipping. Free shipping and saving on local sales tax was the reason I went with this seller. I could have purchased undamaged locally for same price.
customer_reviews.author: Soonerpepa

customer_reviews.title: The best edger ever
customer_reviews.text: The best edger ever. Edger is very easy to assemble, it took me about 20 minutes to put it together and have it running. It starts on the first or second pool, but it's best feature lies in the adjustable cutting head you set it to different angles and it's very easily, plus when you pull the head up the blades stops and that is a great safety feature. I have approximately 250 feet of asphalt driveway, so I need to cut on an angle because that's how the driveway was constructed. With this edger it's very easy. Husband of Teresa.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff.

customer_reviews.title: Good power, very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a very capable edger. Good power, very easy to use. Starts on first pull the majority of the time. Easy maintenance except for changing the oil. Not too difficult, just catches a bit on the metal plate and is a bit tricky not to make too much of a mess.
customer_reviews.author: girlymom

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've been needing/wanting a good edger. I did my research and decided on the Mclane. I'm glad I did. It came in quickly,assembled easily and works great.To the folks that had issues with the throttle, well I don't know. The unit is obviously not meant to run at the motor's rated RPM. I can only assume that this is why they last so long. Oversized motor running a tad slower than full rack. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: McLane lawn edger
customer_reviews.text: It's made in America, functions really good, starts very easily and it works very well. However on the second time I used it the throttle broke. Apparently the throttle has a plastic device which holds the throttle cable and throttle lever. It really irritated me when I saw the cheapness of this device but the upside is you can manually adjust rpm's at the carburetor. I need to call McLane to express my concerns. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: rdependable

customer_reviews.title: Lawn Edger
customer_reviews.text: I bought this over 3 years ago. It is big, clunky and old fashioned; and it works spectacularly especially on large lawns with lots of sidewalk and driveway. It has never failed to start on the first or second pull, even after being stored all winter with a dose of gasoline stabilizer in it. It's so trouble free, I change blades once a year and that's it.
customer_reviews.author: Bird Dog

customer_reviews.title: Performance Pending
customer_reviews.text: I have owned an earlier model before. I gave it away. It was a great machine. I have not used my newly purchased edger yet. My only problem with this one is not enough instruction about the quantity of oil to add since the unit was shipped without oil and gas. I understand why. I will rate performance later. I have to contact a dealer to get my information before I put my toy to work.
customer_reviews.author: Rallen1927

customer_reviews.title: Best Lawn Edger Available!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second McLane 9-inch Gas Powered lawn edger. The first was used and abused for 14 years. I purchased another brand and after only 4 years and a couple of expensive repairs I needed a new one. I felt very lucky to find this on Amazon at a great price. In appearance it is the same as my first McLane, however, I have noticed some small improvements.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara S. Cooke

customer_reviews.title: Engine seized up during first use.
customer_reviews.text: The engine seized during the first use and I have not received a response from the seller with regards to my request for a replacement. I have read similar reviews. Update: still no response from the seller it’s now July 8.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I have a high end electric edger that does the job but moving around 100 ft. of cord and not being able to do my entire lot was a problem. The McLane gets the job done in 1/4 of the time and has the torque not to bog down like the electric edger. It always starts on the first pull and runs smooth. An added plus, I can buy 7 replacement blades for the price of one blade on the electric edger.
customer_reviews.author: M. Geiger

customer_reviews.title: Best money spent!
customer_reviews.text: After doing research both online and a few Home Improvement stores, I chose the McLane. Assembly was a snap! After adding oil&gas, started in the first pull. After weeks of use on many yards, still performs fantastic. Best of all "Made in America"!! Hell Yeah!!!
customer_reviews.author: DLaw

customer_reviews.title: best edger on the market
customer_reviews.text: I owned another brand which I returned. This one might be more money but its the best money you can spend. This edger does it in a quarter of the time the other edger took. As far as I am concerned there are no other edgers. This one is AMAZING. I've mowed my own lawns over 25 years (for myself, not commercially) and its the best i've ever used or seen.
customer_reviews.author: Tindude

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: It does trim very well, but McLane needs to redesign the terrrible height adjusment mechanism-it will not stay in a nuetral mode, it always slips into the 1st setting which results in the blade continuing to spin. Very dangerous. Also, I had to replace the throttle cable (broke), and it has broken again. Not going to replace it a 2nd time, just let the engine start up a full speed.
customer_reviews.author: George M.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: I have used my McLane 801 a total of three(3) times now and I would not change a thing about it. I read a lot of comments where people were having different problems with their edger, I think this could come from not selecting the correct notch in the blade control handle, that is why McLane offers so many choices in their blade control.
customer_reviews.author: Doodles

customer_reviews.title: Best Edger I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: This edger started on the first pull! Filled the oil, put in gas, and, bahm.......started on the first pull. Have been using a Troybilt for years and now I have the best. This one even has grease zerts. Just "sips" gas on top of everything else. The title says it all.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Birchard

customer_reviews.title: worked great. Cutting head pivot point was too tight preventing ...
customer_reviews.text: The first edger shipped came significantly damaged. I called Amazon and they shipped a new one the next day. Impressive customer service! The edger, once adjusted, worked great. Cutting head pivot point was too tight preventing raising & lowering the head via handle. I loosened the bolt and oiled it and it now works well. The motor oil fill caps are positioned in very tight spots, so opening and closing the cap to fill with oil was a challenge, and only the front one is accessable. Motor starts easily (with choke) and the machine does a good job cutting a clean edge. Plenty of power to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Nydam

customer_reviews.title: McLane Edger
customer_reviews.text: The package was delivered absent the start/stop/run cable tie down. The assembly was fairly straight forward except the cotter pins could have been a little longer. The engine started with no trouble but ran a little slow at full throttle. The edger is very stable, much better than 3 wheel versions and makes a clean cut even in wet grass.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Throttle assembly is piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Overall the edger works good, but it's infuriating to pay over $300 for a piece of equipment that cannot work right out of the box. Like everyone else who has complained before, McLane needs to do something about the throttle cable assembly. Mine was broke even before it left the factory, worst thing is, you'd think with all the complaints they would make some decent attempt to fix it. Made in China doesn't seem so bad after all.
customer_reviews.author: El Cheapo

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 9 yrs
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered one yesterday to replace the exact same model last lasted me 9 years of commercial use. Not by several people but I work for myself and it's used every week. Old one still runs fine. A bearing spun in the blade case. I will fix it and keep using it but needed a replacement sooner. Very pleased with mine. Just keep oil changed
customer_reviews.author: Markspm

customer_reviews.title: McLane 801  4.75 gt edger
customer_reviews.text: It started on the first pull out of the box. It was simple to assemble. I did initially have a problem with the handle not staying in the brake slot, which would cause the blade to start spinning when it wasn't supposed to. I had to re-adjust the handle, and so far-so good. The 4-cyle engine produe sufficient torque so that it does not struggle in thisk grass. Surprisinglyu quiet for a gas-powered edger.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Molenda

customer_reviews.title: a little pricey but great quality. arrived with the missing bag that contains ...
customer_reviews.text: this this is a boss. a little pricey but great quality. arrived with the missing bag that contains the grips and a few bolts. I called and they shipped them right out. purchased the replacement blades at Lowe's and also just ordered some factory OEM for same price on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: GrumpyCrumpy

customer_reviews.title: very good quality item
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my grounds department because they were edging with string trimmers and it was hurting their shoulders. I surprised them with it and they LOVE it, been a great performing unit.
customer_reviews.author: tim whipple

customer_reviews.title: Great edger
customer_reviews.text: After some minor difficulty with assembly this machine works really well. It is very well constructed with sturdy material - very little plastic. Some reviews were critical of the throttle linkage but it now is all metal and works well. Engine starts easily and the machine is easy to guide as it edges. Depth of cut for the edger is easy to adjust and control. A very nice machine which looks like it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Chapman

customer_reviews.title: runs fine and starts after one or two pulls
customer_reviews.text: handle grips cheap, the guard that protects the blade just fell off and screw hole to screw back in appears to be worn and stripped. plastic wheels cheap......almost appears to be a chinese made parts that surround the engine. as far as the engine, runs fine and starts after one or two pulls.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great edger!
customer_reviews.text: The engine starts easily and the edger cuts well. It's a great compromise in size between the small weedwacker brand and the large, cumbersome machines. Also, mine was shipped missing its control bar and customer service shipped one immediately, even without my being able to supply my purchase information.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Good except on curbs
customer_reviews.text: Good edger. Does a good job on edges next to sidewalk. Does not work well with curbs. Very awkward to use on curbs. Am now buying the curb kit for extra $68. The curb attachment should come as standard equipment as the edger is of no use on curbs otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: B. H.

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I am happy to say that this product worked as well as I had hoped. I researched many different low and mid priced gas powered edgers and found the common problem to be not enough power. I have several hundred feet of edging with some of it requiring up to a four inch deep cut. This edger had the power to do the job well. Coupled with the ergonomics and four wheel design the work was completed easily and a lot faster than I had planned. I would highly recommend this product for the homeowner.
customer_reviews.author: Ang

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this edger
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that shipping this package is a gamble. After calling the manufacturer in CA I had a good feeling about the company and decided to purchase it. Glad I did. It was a little bit of challenge to put together. Most of the edger was already assembled but the handle needed to be assembled. Also the Briggs & Stratton engine's oil plug is in a difficult position once McLane put it's remaining frame together. It can be worked with but takes some patience. Over all the McLane is a very good piece of equipment and I'm please with the purchase and getting it thru Amazon (saved over $100).
customer_reviews.author: alan

customer_reviews.title: Great product what a time saver
customer_reviews.text: Owned a little wonder edger about 10 years ago and sold it, big mistake I thought until my new McLane edger arrived. This machine arrived and within 1/2 hour I had it put together and started using it. Started real easy 2 pulls machine is very well balanced and rides nicely on the curb it is lite enough to lift and maneuver around tight corners. This is a well built machine and will last any homeowner many years as long as you look after it. I opted to put synthetic oil in being these little motors tend to run hot. I would recommend this machine to anybody who likes to manicure the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Suzi  Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for nearly a year and use it once a week. I live in Florida with heat, humid and where St Augustine grass can be brutal. I edge my sidewalk and driveway as well as edging flower beds around the yard, etc. It's about time to change the blade due to concrete/blade normal wear. No problems so far with engine. Important to follow directions for start up procedure - there's 3 or 4 switches that need to be flipped. It starts like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product works just as advertised. Starts very time on the first pull and does a great job of trimming. As stated in other reviews, there is a problem with the throttle cable. Mine broke the first time I used the machine. One call to McLane had a new heavy duty replacement on the way. Actually talked to a real person. Would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ron P

customer_reviews.title: McLane is a 5 star gas powered lawn edger
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated to spend $300. for an edger. But after checking out reviews of other edgers, I bought McLane 101. The edger arrived with a dented gas tank. I called McLane and within a week I received a new gas tank. First pull and it started. This machine is everything other 4 and 5 star owners have stated.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Design Flaws - Quality Work
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, it is a good piece of equipment that does a nice job edging of my flower beds. Started up 1-2-3, easy to handle. HOWEVER, right rear tire rubs against screw from engine, added spacers to fix problem. Also, dip stick wasn't easy to remove and reinsert. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: NatsFan

customer_reviews.title: Who knows, it is still in the box
customer_reviews.text: It was my own fault because I was in a hurry and did not read the "This product cannot be returned". It was to be a gift and the person already had one. I should not be mad at Amazon but I am because I have spent $330 and it is still in the box. Others have highly recommeded this edger and that is why I ordered it in the first place. Anyone interested in purchasing at a discount?
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Great Edger
customer_reviews.text: Unit works wonderful. This is the second unit that I purchased thru Amazon. The first one the box had been opened and parts were missing and the engine would not start. Amazon was great, the unit was replaced quickly. Edger does a wonderful job of cleaning the edges of the driveway, walks, and gardens. The unit pulls you along, doing about 75% of the effort to move the edger. The cutting head is tilt-able allowing angle cuts under garden beds or grass, or tilted horizontally to use as a trimmer in tough weeds
customer_reviews.author: Dave macCuish

customer_reviews.title: The blade tilts toward the lawn so instead of a nice vertical cut
customer_reviews.text: I had a Mclane edger before this one I bought in 1985 and finally went out on me. assembly on my new one was smooth and started right up. However, when using the first time notice that the blade did not sit vertically when it was welded up. This can't be adjusted out by using the angle adjustment either because you have to much tilt one way or the other. The blade tilts toward the lawn so instead of a nice vertical cut, the blade cuts back into the lawn which does not have a nice clean look. Welders need to pay more attention to detail
customer_reviews.author: Lance Semba

customer_reviews.title: Retired Gardner
customer_reviews.text: Sam H. B. I knew Mclane when he was a lawn mower repairman I bought the first lawn he sold and helped him improve it and also bought one of the first edger he ever made I also worked with him on that. The best one ever! to bad he isn't around to see it now!
customer_reviews.author: Sam H. B.

customer_reviews.title: defective
customer_reviews.text: While easy to assemble it was missing the throttle cable clip when it arrived and the throttle cable needed to be adjusted by hand (not covered by the instructions). Anyway, I put oil and gas in it as per the instructions and started it up. After a few pulls it blew smoke for a few seconds and then failed completley spewing oil onto my driveway. I've owned a lot of gas powered lawn equipment and never had a problem like this. McLane may make some decent edgers, but whatever you do never buy a product like this model with a Briggs engine. While sold by Amazon, note that it is not elgible for return or refund.
customer_reviews.author: davidw

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job.
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a power edger, so I can't compare it to others. There are some moments that I stuggle a little controlling the edger, but all-in-all it does a fantastic job. It sure beats using the manual edger that I've used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: sandlotjoe

customer_reviews.title: Slung a rod
customer_reviews.text: Thought this was an awesome machine. I have a lot of side walk to do and it works like a champ. I purchased an older model at a pawn shop before I bought this one and I was hooked. My only complaint is that I was missing one bolt for the handle assembly which I got from my old one. It will last 20 years. (So I thought) Didn't use it much in the last couple of years and it slung a rod just like the last one. Maybe time to try a different model.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Awesome edger.
customer_reviews.text: Well, as awe struck as you can get on a piece of lawn equipment. Best gas edger made, hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Lionfan

customer_reviews.title: GREAT EDGER!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this edger in August 2009 and it has been fabulous! After sitting for our short winter, it starts with just a couple of pulls. It is tough to try and push it through the grass. Would I buy this again?? Your darn right I would. The BEST edger I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: lakesidegent

customer_reviews.title: Makes Edging Easy
customer_reviews.text: Starts easy, makes quick work of edging, and does not take up much space in the garage. Much quicker than edging by hand and depth is easy to adjust. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Page

customer_reviews.title: Best lawncare investment ever
customer_reviews.text: I have had several string trimmers and some that have edger attachments but none compare to this beast. It is easy and pain free. I have been using it over a year now and would buy it again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Tootie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Years later, awesome edger. Stands the test of time. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Dardos

customer_reviews.title: Ordered but not able to use
customer_reviews.text: Ordered and it came without all parts! No handlebars so useless
customer_reviews.author: NanaG

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and Quality!
customer_reviews.text: McLane makes a great product. I owned for for over 20 years and just replaced it with a new model and love it.
customer_reviews.author: BM

customer_reviews.title: ... edger that I have bought and this is the best one. I have used it several times and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second edger that I have bought and this is the best one. I have used it several times and it has help up well and does a good job.
customer_reviews.author: Windriver

customer_reviews.title: Broken throttle cable, no authorized dealers in area.
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job but cable broke on the first use and can't find anyone in area to do warranty work. Using a string to hold throttle open. I read other reviews about the same problems so I thought that McLane's would have solved this issue by now but I guess not.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Packaging should be changed
customer_reviews.text: After receiving my edger and putting it together, the engine would not turn over. The botton of the recoil starter housing was dented in shipping. After reading reviews on this machine, it seems that this could be avoided if it was packaged better. I removed the housing and pounded out the dent and the engine started right away. To avoid throttle problems, I sprayed the cable with a silicone spray and this worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Chizek

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine
customer_reviews.text: This machine simplified our work tremendously. We needed to cut down some brush and tall grass. This edger worked great, we turned the blade sideways and it cut the tall grass down with very little effort. It cuts into the ground effortlessly when we edge.
customer_reviews.author: jymie

customer_reviews.title: Other than that it works great.
customer_reviews.text: Compared to big-box store edgers of the same price this is a deal. Much nicer than what I looked at there. Just make sure you don't forget to add oil and don't force the gas lever. It is not designed to go to full throttle. Don't know why they don't choose to put a stop on the gas lever and print a new Label. Other than that it works great.
customer_reviews.author: dman

customer_reviews.title: Mclaine Edger
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for a Mclaine edger that I have had for probably twenty years that has served me well but is on it's last leg. McLaine makes a great edger and this one seems to be of the same quality. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value if you don't mind the throttle
customer_reviews.text: Most issues mentioned have been taken care of but the throttle rigging is kind of dumb. I now use the lower throttle lever exclusively and it isn't an issue for me. The rest of the edger works flawlessly and is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Craig L. Catli

customer_reviews.title: Well built - easy start - great job
customer_reviews.text: I bought the edger last summer and only used it twice. When I received the product it was well packaged. Assembly was fairly easy with all parts fitting properly. The engine started after only 3 pulls and runs very smoothly. You do need to use care when reattaching the clip that separates the front wheels. I found it a little tricky to properly snap to front axle. This machine is so much better than similar products found in Home Depot or Lowe's. Does a great job at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Did what I needed it to do.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to put in the wire for a invisible dog fence. It worked great, my soil is almost all clay so I did go through a couple belts and there were times it died on me due to the clay soil and having it on the deepest setting and maybe going to fast but it did what I needed it to do. I am not disappointed it is a good machine.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best in it's class...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product but worse than earlier editions. Too many government regulations...
customer_reviews.author: Scott O

customer_reviews.title: McLane Edger
customer_reviews.text: This edger is a sturdy piece of equipment. It cranks on first pull, is easy to handle, and does a good job. I would recommend the edger.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda C.

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: Was a little afraid of ordering this online without seeing in person, glad I did this is so much better than the cheap junk at Home D, starts and cuts great. Very heavy duty construction and made in USA
customer_reviews.author: J. Richards

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, had the edger just a month
customer_reviews.text: The edger is fine, runs well and easy to use. would make one change in the blade cover design I would prefer to be able to see the blade while using the unit. it is hard to tell how close you are to the edge you are trimming.
customer_reviews.author: GAC

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with purchase. Went through two box store brands over the last 5 years (though learned methanol in engine takes it toll). Finally a edger that I'm confident will last the life of my lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Brent R. Blackburn

customer_reviews.title: Love this edger
customer_reviews.text: Love this edger. It is so easy to use and you don't have to worry about pulling an electric cord along as you edge. The quality of this item is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Edger
customer_reviews.text: Lots of levers I don't know know what they do.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sharma

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Edger for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: McLane has made excellent equiptment for a long time. I have had a commercial edger for years made by McLane. This edger is not the quality of one made years ago, but what is?
customer_reviews.author: William R. Myles

customer_reviews.title: Poor Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Edger arrived with a bent frame. McLane customer service promised to repair, but then ignored/refused attempts to coordinate UPS pick up. Amazon was great to offer to pay for local repair, but I would never again buy a McLane product. Terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Really really works well !
customer_reviews.text: Edging drive and bullet pavers. Solid machine works GREAT. Stabile on uneven turf.
customer_reviews.author: MaryKay Plunger

customer_reviews.title: McLane 801 4.75 gt gas edger
customer_reviews.text: Ordered from Amazon on a Wednesday and received via UPS the following Wednesday in good condition. Assembly took approximately 15 minutes after locating 2 cotter pins that were not included with edger. Filled edger with gas and oil and edged the lawn. The edger has plenty of power and is quiet and smooth running. Removing the spacer and moving the wheel to edge next to the curb was very easy. My previous edger was a Weed Eater which was adequate. The difference between the Weed Eater and the McLane is like comparing a Ferrari with a Yugo!
customer_reviews.author: sschlick

customer_reviews.title: Starts first time/every time!
customer_reviews.text: I love my 'big girl' edger. It works for lots of yard work, not just edging the driveway. The best part is I can start it every time first time.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

product_meta.title: McLane 101-5.5GT-7Gas Powered Lawn Edger, 5.50 Gross Torque/3.5 HP B&S Engine 7" Wheels
product_meta.description:
Size:7" WheelsFROM THE MANUFACTURER
McLane - manufacturing the best quality, precision cutting lawn and garden equipment since 1946. The McLane facility covers over 75,000 square feet in the city of Paramount, CA. McLane produces reel mowers, green mowers, rotary mowers, and edgers. All edgers are made of heavy duty steel frames with dual cutterhead bearings for smooth cutting. Smooth live rubber replaceable tires and chip resistant baked on powder coated paint. McLane has many dealers and distributors located nation wide for your convenience. For a McLane dealer in your area please contact us by phone at (562) 633-8158 or email info@mclanemower.com.
feature_bullets: EDGER AND TRIMMER - Make your yard or outdoor space look incredible with this lawn edger machine. McLane bladed edgers and trimmers use single lever blade clutch and depth control for the exact cut you want.

PRECISE - This motorized trimmer is designed to ride on most curbs while still delivering a clean cut every time. The cutter head is precision machined uses sealed precision ball bearings on a 2” x 9” spring steel blade.

ANY ANGLE - McLane edgers and trimmers cut vertically or horizontally, and do it smoothly thanks to wide rubber tires with ball bearing wheels. The blade can be quickly and easily tilted to almost any angle, and will trim flat at any height.
MEET SAFETY STANDARDS - All McLane edger and trimmers meet all established safety standards.
MADE IN THE USA - This cordless gas powered lawn edger is proudly made in the USA.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars414 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
